ref: 8681 prapāˊ f. ʻ roadside fountain or cistern ʼ AV. [√pā1]
Pa. papā -- f. ʻ shed where water is supplied at roadside ʼ;

lang: MIA. forms occurring in Corpus Inscriptionum Indicarum Vol. II Pt. 1

ref: P. pau m. ʻ watering place, resthouse ʼ (whence paūā m. ʻ one who gives water to travellers to acquire merit ʼ);
WPah. (Joshi) prau, pau m. ʻ watering place ʼ;
Ku. pau ʻ religious distribution of water at roadside, place where it is distributed ʼ;
H. pau f. ʻ place for watering cattle ʼ;
M. pāṇ -- poī f. ʻ shed or stand for supply of water to travellers ʼ; -- in
G. parab, parabṛī f. ʻ watering -- place at roadside ʼ (deriv. parbiyɔ m. ʻ man who there gives water ʼ) b for v is obscure.
